# Draft:Kingsway Christian College, Perth

----
----
Kingsway Christian College, informally known as Kingsway or KCC, is a non-denominational, co-educational K-12, Christian day school located in Darch, a northern suburb of Perth, Western Australia. The College is a member of the [https://www.ais.wa.edu.au/ Association of Independent Schools of Western Australia].
Campus
The College is built on one campus located at 157 Kingsway in Darch, Western Australia. The recently constructed Arts, Technology and Resource Centre are the new additions to the campus.
Kingsway Theatre, which is situated at the college, is also a venue used for public events and performances. The local [https://kingswaychurch.com.au/ Kingsway Christian Church] also holds services at the Kingsway Theatre.
Student life
House system
Kingsway Christian College has four Houses (factions). Students are allocated a House upon entry to the school.
* Carey (Red) - named after William Carey (1761-1834), missionary pioneer to India and founder of the Baptist Missionary Society.
* Flynn (Purple) - named after John Flynn (1880-1951), Presbyterian minister and missionary in Australia and founder of the Royal Flying Doctor Service.
* Livingstone (Gold) - named after David Livingstone (1813-1873), missionary, doctor and explorer of Africa.
* Taylor (Blue) - named after J. Hudson Taylor (1832-1905), missionary pioneer to China and founder of the China Inland Mission.
Co-curriculum
The primary school offers a number of after-school clubs and activities, notably golf and basketball. Students in the golf club practice a range of golf skills and techniques at the Chip and Putt practice facility located on campus.
Sports
Basketball
Kingsway Christian College is notable for its Basketball Academy, which has produced some well-known professional basketball players. The college has partnered with Coach Andy Stewart (from “[https://coachinghoops.com.au/ Coachinghoops]”), a former head coach of the Perth Lynx and former assistant coach for the Perth Wildcats, to provide a Specialist Basketball program offering tailored coaching sessions and classes to students in Year 7 to Year 12. The college provides basketball as an optional elective to the Upper School students. Students complete studies in the practical components of the game of Basketball and coaching sessions are held at either the nearby [https://warwickstadium.com.au/ Warwick Stadium] or on the College’s basketball facilities.
In 2024, it was announced that [https://nbl1.com.au/player-listing/ashlee-monaghan Ashlee Monaghan] will be completing her studies at Kingsway Christian College, under an academic and basketball scholarship.
Notable alumni
* Hon. Mayor Albert Jacob - Mayor of the City of Joondalup
* Aldrich Potgieter - South African professional golfer
* Majok Maker Majok - South Sudanese-Australian professional basketball player
* Jo Lual-Acuil - South Sudanese-Australian professional basketball player
* [https://www.kingsway.wa.edu.au/celebrating-40-years-of-kingsway-christian-college-our-community/ Scott Joy] - Former Chief Operating Officer of the [https://warwickstadium.com.au/about-us/ Warwick Stadium/CCRSA]
Incident
In 2021, a baby was found dead by her mother in the family car at Kingsway Christian College. The mother was collecting another child from an independent after-hours daycare located on the campus at the time.
